intro: Psiadia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf psiadia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Psiadia angustifolia is often found in open habitats such as cliffs and coastal areas.
